title: 820-00165 On (I think?) But no display
message:
Hello

Macbook Air - replaced screen and tested backlight works OK
When I power on after disconnecting battery the "Bong" sound goes repeatedly, untill I restart once, then it will "turn on" normally but with no display.  
Nothing on the display best I can tell, even with torch in the background

Machine drawing about 600ma with computer connected to power and battery.

Ideas?

title: 820-00165 On (I think?) But no display
message:
Caps Lock light reacts, USB activity, or external video?
You must be sure it doesn't get stuck after chime.

Just in case, check SMC_LID.

title: 820-00165 On (I think?) But no display
message:
Hello

I saw on another thread similar to this about replacing the bios chip.

I did this and now the computer functions as it should.

title: 820-00165 On (I think?) But no display
message:
Hello
No caps lock or other signs of working.

I did get it to display the apple folder icon once but not seen that again.
Installed a known good test SSD which gets very hot.

title: 820-00165 On (I think?) But no display
message:
Random symptom may point to dropped machine.
You may have broken trace, solders...
